channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Israeli’s tearful plea decrying Gaza aid convoy attacks
item.description: An Israeli human rights lawyer interrupts interview with tearful plea condemning Israel’s war on Gaza.

item.title: Passage of ‘foreign influence’ bill sparks clashes at Georgian parliament
item.description: Police scuffled with protesters on the steps of Georgia’s parliament after passage of a “foreign influence" bill.

item.title: Gunmen kill two guards, free inmate in France prison van attack
item.description: Justice minister says two wounded prison guards in critical condition after van ambushed while transporting prisoner.

item.title: Not even the US government knows the US government line on Rafah
item.description: And as conflicting chatter carries on in Washington, Israel keeps on killing.

item.title: Israeli flag-raising in major Canadian cities spurs outrage amid Gaza war
item.description: Rights advocates say decision to fly Israeli flags on country's independence day 'completely inappropriate' and hurtful.

item.title: How has the war on Gaza changed the narrative among young people?
item.description: We look into how the war on Gaza has been reshaping global perceptions among youth in the West.

item.title: Michael Cohen resumes testimony in Trump hush-money trial
item.description: Trump's former lawyer set to face tough cross-examination after testifying ex-president took part in hush money scheme.

item.title: Al Jazeera reporter questions Biden adviser over Gaza ‘genocide’ definition
item.description: Al Jazeera's Kimberly Halkett challenges US national security advisor on whether Gaza fits the definition of genocide.

item.title: Israeli protesters attack aid trucks destined for Gaza
item.description: Israeli protesters attacked aid trucks and destroyed humanitarian supplies destined for desperate Palestinians in Gaza.

item.title: Cannes film festival hopes for ‘no controversies’ as wars, scandals rage
item.description: The film industry is on edge as the Israel-Palestine conflict and Me Too accusations cast shadows on the red carpet.

item.title: What is behind Russia’s nuclear escalation threat?
item.description: Brinkmanship in the war in Ukraine might be nearing its natural limits; this could pave the way for diplomacy.

item.title: Georgia Parliament passes ‘foreign agents’ bill amid scuffles
item.description: The bill requires organisations receiving more than 20 percent of their funding from abroad to register as foreign agents.

item.title: Did the UN really say Israel has killed fewer people in Gaza?
item.description: Changes in how the UN calculates Gaza's casualties have been cited as evidence of bias. They aren't.

item.title: Tunisian police arrest lawyer in new raid on bar association headquarters
item.description: Arrest of Mahdi Zagrouba comes two days after detention of another lawyer and two journalists.

item.title: Boeing’s jets turn 70: A timeline of highs, lows and turbulence
item.description: Boeing, founded in 1916, has experienced good times and bad during its more than 100 years in the air.

item.title: EU signs off on sweeping migration overhaul ahead of elections
item.description: New Pact on Migration and Asylum approval comes as EU prepares to hold elections in which migration could be pivotal.

item.title: Japan’s famous brother-and-sister act eye more Olympic judo gold
item.description: Three years after the Tokyo Olympics, Japan's Hifumi Abe and his sister Uta want to go for gold again in Paris Olympics.

item.title: Russian corruption probe widens as senior defence official arrested
item.description: Yuri Kuznetsov, the second senior official arrested in the case, is accused of bribery after being found holding $1m.

item.title: Russia’s Putin to visit China in first foreign trip since re-election
item.description: The Russian leader's May 16-17 visit aims to underscore the deepening 'no limits' partnership with China's Xi Jinping.

item.title: Russia’s defence rejig: ‘Unfortunately for Ukraine, a very effective move’
item.description: Analysts predict Andrei Belousov will boost Russia's military-industrial complex as Kyiv's forces struggle on the front.

item.title: Unrest wracks French Pacific territory of New Caledonia
item.description: Authorities impose an overnight curfew and ban gatherings after violent unrest in the capital, Noumea.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire deadlocked as Israel’s Rafah attacks set talks ‘backward’
item.description: Qatar says mediation efforts are being hampered by Israel’s offensive on Gaza’s southern city.

item.title: Palestinians mark 76 years of Nakba as new tragedy unfolds in Gaza
item.description: The Nakba is at the core of the Palestinian struggle, but in many ways pales in comparison to Israel's war on Gaza.

item.title: Israeli forces attacked ‘known aid worker locations’ in Gaza: Rights group
item.description: Human Rights Watch says aid workers' convoys and facilities have been targeted at least eight times since last October.

item.title: A UN resolution on the Srebrenica genocide ignites old tensions
item.description: Leaders from Serbia and Bosnia's Republika Srpska have been campaigning against the adoption of a UN resolution.
